message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.GR 

This paper discusses the use of neural networks to generate piecewise linear functions with a large number of linear regions, which is a topic closely related to neural network architecture and optimization (cs.NE). The paper also discusses the application of these functions in generating natural-looking landscape textures in artificial images, which falls under computer vision (cs.CV). Additionally, the paper explores the capacity of neural networks to efficiently approximate iterated function systems, which is a topic related to machine learning (cs.LG) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper discusses the potential for new algorithms for representing self-similarities in images based on the neural network mechanism, which falls under graphics (cs.GR).
